posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
The three main reasons to take SD are:
(1) HiPS (only needs 1 level)
(2) to get the feats required for Epic Dodge (needs 5 levels for Defensive Roll, or 10 to also get Improved Evasion)
(3) Uncanny Dodge (second level)
All of these are either useless or much less useful in a STR-based build, so the question is why do you want to take SD in a STR-based build, and why 13 levels?

Dividing the remaining 27 levels between Fighter and WM will result in a reasonably capable build, but the 13 levels in SD are basically just thrown away, and you lose the opportunity to take a more useful third class.

That said, and meeting your restrictions, I'd say either Fighter 8 / WM 19 / SD 13 or Fighter 20 / WM 7 / SD 13.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:why 13 levels?
At SD level 10 you get improved evasion, a good thing to have, especially in a low reflex-save strength build, but not worth it if standard IE items are available. At SD level 13 the SD gets a bonus feat and can upgrade the Shadow lord to Epic shadow lord.
Adding 9 epic levels of WM gives 3 bonus feats and an AB increase of +3. Adding 12 WM levels gives 4 feats and +4 AB. I prefer the WM goodies rather than the summon, even if upgraded.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: You didn't take Blind Fight, which is essential for a melee build. I would take SD at levels 22, 27, 32, and 37 for Tumble skill dumps for +1 AC each time. Epic Weapon Spec would be nice to have earlier than level 40. You might consider replacing 2 Great Strength feats with Overwhelming Crit and Devastating Crit, unless your playing environment has reasons not to take Dev Crit, or you don't want to lose the AB and damage.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I think Empyre's suggestions are spot on. Blind Fight needs to be in there, the question is, at the expense of what? At first glance, I would drop Disarm, for 2 reasons:

1- Disarm works best with 2-handed weapons, and Katanas are one-handed.
2- Disarm without Improved Disarm generates an attack of opportunity for your enemy when you try to use it.

However, Great Cleave without Devastating Critical is a bit useless. You're not going to kill many monsters in 1-round at that level, so the general rule is: you either take it for Devcrit, or, if it's disabled in your server, you don't take it.

You can drop Great Cleave for Improved Disarm if you're really keen on having it, then you have to choose another feat to drop for Blind Fight, or you can drop Disarm for Blind Fight and then Great Cleave for something else, like Knockdown, which your build doesn't have, strangely. Is immunity to KD very common in your server? If so, then take Toughness for more HP. If not, drop Disarm for KD, delay Improved Critical a bit and take it earlier, then drop Great Cleave for Blind Fight.

I also second Empyre's advice on skill dumps. This is one of the most essential things in character buildings. Not just what class you'll take, but WHEN will you take it. SD levels should be taken in levels that will allow your skill ranks in Tumble to reach multiples of 5. If you'd read my guide, you'd know this. See, being lazy has its setbacks lol

Anyway, the feat choice is cool in epics, but I'd take Fighter 7 and Fighter 8 RIGHT AFTER WM 13 for earlier EWS. I'd also consider taking that last SD level at 37 for the last Tumble dump so that you can have your clone for more levels. You'll lose a couple of Stealth points, but you'll have 2 of yourself, which is COOL.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: You can't do that, and here's why: You can take WM after 6 levels of Fighter, but you need 17 levels of Fighter / WM to cross-train 10 ranks of Hide to qualify for SD. Since you can have no more than 10 levels of WM pre-epic (because it is a prestige class), you must also take 7 levels of Fighter before taking SD, but you can at least wait until after the 10 levels of WM to take the 7th level of Fighter.
